availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Organized and mustered in at Cleveland, Ohio, and Camp Dennison, Ohio, from August through October, 1861. Mustered out at St. Louis, Missouri, on September 11, 1865. Officer(s): Colonels Charles Doubleday, Augustus V. Kautz, A. Bayard Nettleton, and Dudley Seward.

ab.bibl:
Frederick H. Dyer, A Compendium of the War of the Rebellion: Compiled and Arranged from Official Records of the Federal and Confederate Armies, Reports of the Adjutant Generals of the Several States the Army Registers, and other Reliable Documents and Sources, (Des Moines, Iowa: The Dyer Publishing Co., 1908), pp. 1473-74.
Official Roster of the Soldiers of the State of Ohio in the War of the Rebellion, vol. 11, 1861-1866 (Akron: Werner Printing, 1891), 51-3.
